passages.text: We are in the midst of a meaning crisis. We have lost the practices and institutions that used to connect us to what is sacred.
Relevance realization is the process by which the brain generates what matters from the chaos of information.
Wisdom is not just knowing things. It is knowing how to live well—and being transformed by that knowledge.
We don't just believe propositions. We participate in the world. And that participatory knowing is often more fundamental than propositional knowledge.
The self is not a thing you have. It is a process you do. And wisdom is about transforming that process.
Insight is not just seeing something new. It is a restructuring of the very way you are making sense of things.
The opposite of bullshitting is not truth-telling. It is caring about the truth.
Flow states give us a taste of what it's like when relevance realization is working optimally. That's why they feel so meaningful.
Religio means to bind together again. What the ancients meant by religion was practices that reconnect you to yourself, to others, and to the world.
The sage is not someone who has all the answers. The sage is someone whose questions have become deep enough to transform how they live.
Self-deception is not just lying to yourself. It is organizing your attention so that you don't notice what would disturb you.
Opponent processing means that the brain generates meaning through dynamic tension—like how you see depth through two eyes that disagree.
We need an ecology of practices—not a single solution—to address the meaning crisis. No one practice will save us.
The Socratic method is not about refuting people. It is about helping them realize that they don't know what they think they know—so they can actually begin to learn.
Platonic anagoge is the process of being drawn upward by the beautiful toward the good and the true. It's not just intellectual—it transforms you.
The axial age discovered that you can cultivate a second self—a self that can observe and transform the first self. That's the birth of self-transcendence.
Gnosis is not just knowing about something. It is being transformed by your knowing—the way knowing a person changes you.
Agency is not just doing what you want. It is being able to want what you would want if you could step back and see yourself more clearly.
The sacred is not supernatural. It is that which is experienced as inexhaustibly deep, with which we can be in an ever-deepening relationship.
Bullshit is not lying. Bullshit is not caring whether what you say is true or false. And we are drowning in it.
